thread.title: Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe: London vigil for Hampstead mother imprisoned in Iran
thread.title_full: Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe: London vigil for Hampstead mother imprisoned in Iran

title: Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe: London vigil for Hampstead mother imprisoned in Iran
text:
Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe: London vigil for Hampstead mother imprisoned in Iran Sunday 15 January 2017 13:14 BST Click to follow Detained: Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe has been held in solitary confinement 
A London vigil is to be held for a British-Iranian mother imprisoned in Tehran . 
The vigil for Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe will take place outside the Iranian Embassy in London on Monday January 16, said organisers Amnesty International UK. 
The charity worker was jailed for five years last September for allegedly plotting to topple the government in Tehran. 
Mrs Zaghari-Ratcliffe, from Hampstead, was arrested at Tehran Airport in April while she was with her daughter Gabriella, and later jailed. 
Monday's vigil, to be held between 4pm and 6pm, is timed to mark one year since the Washington Post journalist Jason Rezaian and other US-Iranian dual-nationals were released from prison in Iran. 
Mrs Zaghari-Ratcliffe's husband, Richard Ratcliffe, will attend the vigil and deliver a letter to the Iranian Embassy renewing his call for her release. 
The 38-year-old appealed against her prison sentence earlier in January, but no decision has been communicated by the Iranian authorities, said Amnesty. Read more
